title: Filipinos In Kuwait Sent More Money To Philippines This Year
description: KUWAIT CITY, Nov 18: Official data released by the Central Bank of the Philippines shows that remittances from Filipino workers in Kuwait grew by 4.71% during the first nine months of this year, reaching USD 453.04 million. This marks an increase from the USD 432.7 million recorded during the same p...

title: Philippines cash remittances up 3.7% in September to $3.1 billion
description:
MANILA – Cash remittances rose 3.7% to $3.1 billion in September from a year ago, the Philippine central bank said on Monday.

The figure brought cash remittances through banks in the first nine months of the year to $26.03 billion, up 3.2% from the same period last year.

title: Philippine digital economy on track for $36 billion in value by 2025
description:
The Philippine digital economy is sustaining a powerful double-digit growth and remains firmly on track to hit $36 billion in gross merchandise value (GMV) by 2025, according to the 10th edition of the e-Conomy SEA 2025 Report.

title: CCC: Circular economy pivotal in reinforcing climate resilience
description:
Circular economy solutions play a critical role in strengthening climate resilience, ensuring business continuity and supporting sustainable economic growth.

description:

title: Philippines may take 70 years to catch up with Singapore
description:
The Philippine economy is at risk of further falling behind its Southeast Asian neighbors, an economist said, noting it may take two years to catch up with Vietnam and up to 70 years to catch up with Singapore.

title: New Philippine finance minister expected to retain policies, say rating firms
description:
MANILA: The Philippines’ credit profile is expected to be unaffected under the new finance minister with rating agencies, which rank the nation as investment grade, expecting policy continuity.

title: PBBM optimistic of economic rebound as inflation eases
description:
President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. is optimistic that the economy will “recover by 2026 and return to the government’s target range by 2027” after Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP) officials reported inflation declining to 1.7 percent. the Presidential Communications Office (PCO) said on Thursday.

title: Advocates warn dangers of lower interest caps
description:
